root.title: Kezek-Hure (e-58)
root.store: The monument had been delivered to the Tyva museum in 1961.
root.general: The deer stone is made of fine-grained grey sandstone. Oval in section. Surface is processed. Sides are smoothed by aeration. The surface carries traces of destruction in the form of having chopped off.
root.description: The epitaph text covers more ancient images of the deer stone. The text is vertical on two opposite sides of the column. Fragments of lines I and II on the face of the stone are most distinctly stored.
root.size: Height – 229 cm, length – 37 cm, width – 25 cm
root.investigation: Evtyuhova and Kiseliyev found in 1947. A fragment of the inscription without reading was published in 1960. The fragment of other sides of the stele was published in 1963. L.R.Kyzlasov 514, D.D.Vasilev investigated.

pdf.f_title: Памятники тюркской рунической письменности азиатского ареала.

refs.ref: Малов С.Е. Енисейская письменности тюрков. М.-Л.,1952. С.39-40.
